definition: to be eradicated/to vanish/extinct/to break off relations
to cut short/extinct/to disappear/to vanish/absolutely/by no means

sentences.english: We should preserve the species such as black-faced spoonbills from extinction.
sentences.chinese: 我們應該保護像黑面琵鷺這種鳥類免於絕跡。

sentences.english: This means that soft corals simply vanish in response to environmental stresses.
sentences.chinese: 這意味着，由於受到環境的壓力，軟珊瑚會最終絕跡。

sentences.english: That kind of epidemic disease has long been stamped out.
In more recent years, cigarette advertising has disappeared due to government regulations.
sentences.chinese: 最近幾年，在政府規定的干預下，香菸廣告已經絕跡。

sentences.english: But before they became extinct, big coupes were kings of the automotive jungle.
sentences.chinese: 在徹底絕跡之前，大型雙門轎跑一直是車市的王者。

sentences.english: When to Eastern Han Dynasty, the hollow brick reduces suddenly, results in vanishes.
sentences.chinese: 東漢時，空心磚驟然減少，終至絕跡。

sentences.english: The fire had depleted the game in the forest.
sentences.chinese: 那場大火使森林裏的鳥獸瀕臨絕跡。
中國純種漢人已經絕跡。

sentences.english: No carriage rattled by on the road outside. Half past struck lugubriously from the church tower.
sentences.chinese: 路上車輛絕跡，教堂的鐘淒涼地在敲半點鐘。

sentences.english: There is and has always been more than a whiff of snobbery about lamentations that reading is doomed to extinction.
sentences.chinese: 總是有一股悲觀思潮，認爲讀書註定要絕跡。

sentences.english: Bong - 1. An almost extinct species of extra wide pitons .
sentences.chinese: 一種幾乎絕跡的很寬的巖釘。

sentences.english: If too many of these rare animals are killed, their kind will die out.
sentences.chinese: 如果過多地屠殺這些稀有動物，它們很快就會絕跡。

sentences.english: Bong - 1 . An almost extinct species of extra wide pitons.
sentences.chinese: 一種幾乎絕跡的很寬的巖釘。

definition: to be of no interest to anyone (idiom)
can be counted on one's fingers (idiom)/very few
to close down (temporarily or permanently)/to go out of business
to count/to count as/to regard as/to enumerate (sb's shortcomings)
to extinguish/to become extinct/to die out
to break up into components/to disintegrate/to collapse/to crumble
rare/not familiar (to the speaker)/sth rarely experience/hard to see
to cut prices/to discount/to mark down/price cutting
